flow.descriptionCdata:
fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.0e739f8a-a2c9-4361-a81d-6eea18c89d95.prompt=Host\: fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.2c00f2f8-affa-4a45-883f-4d55ca038c3b.description=
Get the current status of a Windows service

Input Parameters\:
host - hostname or ip address of the target machine
service - name of service to change
user - alternate credentials username
password - alternate credentials password

Responses\:
service paused - the service is currently paused
service running - the service is currently running
service stopped - the service is currently stopped
service pending - the service is currently pending
failure - there was a problem getting the state of the service
fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.2c55a451-65b7-4b7e-bb2c-2f7f2ae73097.description=Checks to see if the specified service exists on a Windows machine. fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.2de536f0-ed30-4e9d-8ee8-41053b116801.description=
Changes the status of a Windows service to the requested status.

Inputs\:
host - The hostname or ip address of the target machine.
service - The name of the service to change.
requestedstatus - The requested service status. Valid values are\: running, stopped, paused.
user - The username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (Example\: domain\username). 
password - The password of the user.
startdependants - Start all dependant services. Valid values are\: true, false.
serviceTimeout - The amount of time, in seconds, a single service is allowed to take (it affects the main service and the dependant services).
operationTimeout - The total amount of time, in seconds, the operation is allowed to take for all services combined.

Responses\:
service paused - The service is currently paused.
service running - The service is currently running.
service stopped - The service is currently stopped.
service pending - The service is currently pending.
failure - There was a problem setting the state of the service.
fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.49cf1c12-d29c-438a-968a-d9be63db7133.prompt=FileName\: fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.5ce98bde-c7b8-427f-ac64-0558a465449a.prompt=Password\: fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.62a19a4f-82df-41bb-8d52-41fb0a89a1e6.transition.description=${service} is stopped fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.6becd03f-0c98-4e62-82db-491336a942eb.transition.description=Service ${service} does not exist on ${host} fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.714abd73-37f8-481d-98ac-9af046ce3acf.prompt=Host\: fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.7373b74a-3259-4f85-9a46-fbf20a81e265.description=
Pings the target computer from a Windows host computer.

Input Parameters\:
host 		- The hostname or IP address of the host computer to ping from.
user 		- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password 		- Password of the user.
target 		- The target computer to ping.
packets 		- The number of packets to send to the target computer.
packetSize 		- The size of packets to send to the target computer.
command 		- DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.
characterSet 	- The character encoding of the target computer. The default is RAS machine's default encoding.
outputPath 		- A network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible it should be changed to use another share that the local system account on the host computer has write-access to. By default, the path must be changed on Windows 2000 computers.

Responses\:
success 		- The target computer responded to all ping requests.
failure 		- The target computer did not respond to any ping request.
diagnosed		- The target computer responded only to some ping requests.
Connection Error	- The host computer could not be found or user credentials supplied to connect to it are incorrect.
Unknown Target	- The target computer could not be resolved to an IP address.

Result\:
The output of the ping operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult		- The raw output of the Ping operation.
address 		- The actual IP address of the target computer.
% Packet Loss 	- The percentage of packets that ping replies were not received for.
average latency	- The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency 		- The maximum response time of all the ping reqeusts (in milliseconds).
min latency 		- The minimum number of milliseconds that was taken to receive a ping response.

Note\: If an encoding is not given by user, the batch file will be created using the RAS machine's default encoding,
That may cause to corruption in a case where remote machine's encoding is different than the RAS machine's one.
In that case,user must define the appropriate 'characterSet'
The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must not be Unicode (ex. UTF-8, UTF-16).
fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.776869b7-3eb6-4b29-9613-5a0eba122f99.transition.description=Unable to get status of ${service} on {$host} fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.7a1477eb-7652-40f9-bfa2-e99380964a1c.transition.description=Found {$service} on {$host} fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.7d250f23-8b3b-42d4-8163-21cefb7020b9.transition.description=Unable to change the status of ${service} fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.86ebb6e5-5fad-416e-b224-834f6b8c971c.prompt=Should results be stored in session fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.9e9cb7b2-3b9d-47d8-ab2e-fd9a1596d888.description=
Reads the file specified in the source input parameter.  If Store is true, then all matching lines are pushed into the Session and then subsequent calls to the operation results in the next line being returned.

Inputs\:
source - Path to the file to be read.
filter - Regular expression filter to be applied to each line (can be left blank for all).
store - Whether to store results in the session for retrieval. Valid values \: true,false
delimiter - If set to null, the file is read line by line, otherwise it is a delimiter placed between read lines (note, the entire file may or may not still be fully read at once, depending on size).
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.
eofReset - If set to true than after the No More response has been returned once, the operation will restart reading the file from the beginning on the next call.
characterSet - The character encoding used to read the file (for instance, windows-1252). The default is UTF-8.

Responses\:
more lines - More lines are available to be read in the session.
no more lines - No lines are available for reading in the session.
failure - If something went wrong. 

Results\:
returnResult - One line read from the file. New line characters are removed from the line read.
COUNT - On the first pass, the total number of lines matched.  On subsequent runs, the number of lines remaining in the session. This result is only returned in line-by-line mode.
fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.a15e4046-8037-4610-a8f4-4a2d5eb1080e.prompt=Reset to the beginning of file after reading fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.a4307fed-bba1-4fda-ab16-a07eba11ec0d.callout=This flow starts a stopped service. The first step prompts for a host and the service to check. The Alternate Credentials tell Operations Orchestration how to connect to the system. The values entered are placed into context variables so later steps may use them without requiring further user input. If the Service is already running the flow ends, otherwise the status is set to Running. To change the flow for a specific service, double click on the Does Service Exist step and modify the service Input to be A Specific Value. fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.a8d2839e-dd2d-4972-baa2-ba7bb40bc7c2.prompt=Target host\: fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.c586416e-a856-4df4-9a7a-069a55e7c1ba.prompt=Username\: fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.d43db3cf-13bb-4d02-b966-5078acfc4e19.transition.description=${service} is now running fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.description=Use this flow to restart a Windows service. You may easily modify the inputs to make a version that is specific to a particular service or to use a standard set of security credentials. 
Input Parameters\:
host - The host on which the service should be restarted.
servuice - The service that should be restarted.
altuser - The user for connecting to the host (Example\: domain\username).
altpass - The password for connecting to the host.

Responses\:
failure - Service does not exist, could not have its status checked, or could not be started.
success - Service has been started.
fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.ea3810c2-73cd-4dbd-8402-1251069c7fc6.transition.description=${service} is already running fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.f947ddde-bba8-4399-a72e-91b0f838e20f.transition.description=${service} is pending fc185392-193f-4ea5-874e-5a10a628f37a.fb2cde65-22b8-4b84-882a-61ff8f48d35a.prompt=Service\:
flow.name: Modified Restart Service
